As I continued my sorting and stacking I felt a pinch in my chest death is a barbed topic but particularly with the child who lost his mother only two years before I shuffled pass the pictures of dead relatives
... fall still again and max prompt his elbows on my table resting his chin on the heels of his up turned poems what about them he asked
Pointing to a picture of my sister and her family he'd known them his whole life just as he had known me played with my niece and nephew regularly making just a year older Matt two years younger than max
... birthday parties and family dinners but I could see that he was beginning to grasp the change that we were about to undergo
Gym and I will be your aunt and uncle Megan in that will be your cousins sweet you fed looking into my face for the first time since it entered the room
His eyes were chocolate pools his thick dark hair a sleek shiny coat that made me want to run my fingers over it I don't have any boy cousins
And how about him
My brother John well he'll be your uncle I was especially happy to share my younger brother with max John loved kids and being much like a giant kid himself had a knack for being silly with some
Resorted stacks of aunts and uncles cousins and friends wow you have a lot of people max side I suppose I Do
He began to finger through the stacks messing up what I'd sordid my original task no longer mattered
As we near the bottom of the stack honey thick warmth began to fill me perhaps my family was to be the unexpected dowry I'd bring to this little boy who'd already lost so much
Will he claimed laughing at my third grade picture the one where my hair had been extended to do dimensions buying especially humid Indiana Day
At moments like those max was just a little boy point with energy easy with a laugh he ... he goes
Watch teenage mutant ninja turtles and toss the halls
And other times when he was still or thought no one was looking it seemed that the earth's pool was just a little stronger where he stood hugging the corners of his mouth downward making his eyes appearing years older than the number of his birthdays would imply
Just as I was about to put the last of the pictures into the box max press to finger once more to face and who will this be to me
But ... his finger I could see the edges of my own space
I was suddenly flooded with a heart swell for which I had known name
This child of the man I loved was becoming my son we have family Christmas cards in school are stuck with magnets to the fridge I'd make goody bag is a birthday party is snap pictures of graduations
All these things I'd never allowed myself to want thinking that perhaps my own history had left me to wounded to allow myself children of my own
I was becoming a mother but without the benefit of a growing belly or a baby shower to prepare me
I should know the answer to a simple question I should know how to say just the right why's magical thing but I didn't so I offered to therapists cop that question well what do you think
Mac shrugged then looked away and I knew it was my job to field this one jumbled words Bob to the surface up my mind like those triangle shaped answers floating in the blue waters of magic eight ball
Finally the image rose to the surface of the your second mom I said oh I'm Sorry that your first mom died I liked her a lot
Silence loaded between us then max leaned against me his chin still in his palms what should I call you he asked not looking at me I've known him his whole life and he told me that see all that time
My heart pound it against the cage of my ribs my stomach turned over momma I wanted to cry I'll be your mom and you'll be my son I resisted
You can call me mom or mama you can also call me ... if you'd rather whatever feels okay for you
He stood there a minute and I waited thinking I'd get a pronouncement of minute title what's for dinner he asked picking up his ball burgers sweet he said tossing the ball as he walked out of the room

At our wedding a few months later Tom and I said our vows to one another then Max's invited to stand beside us and I made vows to max I promise to step into the shoes his mother had been forced to leave behind and to be the best mother I could be
I promised to help him remember her
After the wedding for the next few days max tried on a new titled for me can we go bowling he'd ask and he'd follow the question by mouthing the word
The word was silent it seemed he was trying to get on seeing how it goes in his mouth
My hopes floated like a pinch helium balloons and then like a thousand hornets guilt attacked that balloon piercing it until it lost its hair and sank
It felt wrong to take such pleasure and seeing his little plump that's formed that singular sellable after all this new son of mine was an inheritance that I did not have if he and Tom hadn't sustain such enormous loss
I felt smaller and smaller still when old habits resumed and Betsy was once again my only title I took the shameful disappointment away telling new one
Weeks later as I drove them home from school max pulled out a baggy full of cheese it's from his ninja turtles lunch box he marched away licking each finger of it's orange dust was his focus deep inside the near empty snack bag he suddenly said
I noticed I don't call your mom I Breathe to come my voice
I noticed that one last cracker than four fingers topic when I say Betsy I'm mean mom I swallowed past the dry rock that informed in my throat thanks I said that's nice to know
He looked out the window moms die you know I think maybe it's safer if you're just Betsy
We could have had a long talk about magical thinking in death and how nothing he could say or not say could cause me to tire could have caused his mother to die
But this just didn't seem like the time for all of that I Will cheers away not wanting to overwhelm him he had so much to Terry thanks but I appreciate you telling me
Those big chocolate ice found mine I waited he Pepsi yeah I said delighted with the new sound of my old name what's for dinner [noise]
